title: Riddle...
content:
Other people use it all the time but you almost never use it. What is it?





Scroll down for the answer...




















































Your name.Signed, Harvey Smith
A proud member of the beta testing society
"I help entertain!" -Harvey

title: Re: Riddle...
content:
Nobody uses my name. Its always AD, adis, aids, or hey you! Stop in the name of the law!


Next riddle: Why is a raven like a writing desk?

title: Re: Riddle...
content:
Because it is considered anti-social to attack a desk with an axe, which is also true when attacking a raven.

"I haven't the slightest idea," said the Hatter...--------------

title: Re: Riddle...
content:
Hey, there's usually only one letter in an envelope.

And the answer to my riddle was 'they both have quills'

Here's another: What do you eat before its born and after its dead?

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: *gets technical*
content:
An egg. Well, technically I don't eat them, but if I did it would fit the bill. Also any (cooked) non-animal food would suit, since they're not born in the first place... but then can something be considered to occur before something that's not going to happen?

I use my name all the time, my writing desk doesn't have a quill, and a letter isn't much of a letter without lots of letters (not to mention that it can easily contain several pieces of paper, or even simply a cheque, or a card).

Edit: Hmm... actually the eggs we eat, unless I'm greatly mistaken, aren't fertilised and thus won't ever 'be born'... thus, the logic does indeed carry over to vegetables and the like. And in fact any inanimate object if 'after' and 'before' can both be relative to a nonexistent factor.

Either that or I'm wrong about the egg thing in the first place. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: *gets technical*
content: Ha, now I got the 'envelope' thing! I didn't think it as a wordplay first.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rolleyes.gif[/img] Eat your veggies!

title: Re: *gets technical*
content:
A man was riding on his horse to go to the geroceries on Wednesday. The next day, he rode on his horse to go to the geroceries on Wednesday again.


How is this possible?


Scroll down to find out...

















































































His horse's name is "Wednesday"Signed, Harvey Smith
A proud member of the beta testing society
"I help entertain!" -Harvey
Tough guys have no table manners![img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopefish.gif[/img]

title: Re: *gets technical*
content:
Spleen is correct about the eggs. Another answer is chickens as we eat them after we've killed them and before they're born [eggs, which, can be fertilized, not all hens are battery hens]

Writing desks did have quills when the riddle was written; that is where we get the term 'quill pen' from. I told you it was an old riddle.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society
